description: Space mission-critical control software - Cleanroom for deep space probe
projectName: Deep Space Probe Attitude Control System
systemDescription: Attitude determination and control system (ADCS) for deep space probe mission. Controls spacecraft orientation using reaction wheels and thrusters based on star tracker and gyroscope inputs. Implements pointing algorithms for antenna communication with Earth, solar panel sun-pointing, and scientific instrument targeting. Operates autonomously for extended periods due to communication delays (up to 20 minutes). Includes fault detection, isolation, and recovery (FDIR) for sensor and actuator failures. Must maintain precise pointing (< 0.01 degrees) for antenna communication and science operations. Designed for 10+ year mission life with no maintenance possible.
notes: NASA requires formal methods for mission-critical spacecraft software
No possibility of patching or repair once launched
Pointing algorithms must be mathematically proven for stability
FDIR must be proven to handle all credible failure scenarios
Mixed usage profile: typical operations + worst-case failures
Long mission life demands extremely high reliability
Autonomous operation requires verification of all decision logic
Statistical testing includes long-duration mission simulations
Cleanroom methodology proven in previous NASA missions
